ai.summary: A short, easy 0.9 km hike on the Accessible Trail in Crom, UK. The route is designed for quick outings and suited to beginners, families, and those seeking a relaxed outdoor experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The path is flat and well maintained, with a surfaced surface (paved or compact gravel) throughout most of the route. Gentle gradients and occasional minor irregularities may occur after weather events; benches are provided for rest.
ai.safety_notes: This is a short, easy trail, but weather in the UK can change quickly. Wear sturdy shoes and bring a light jacket and water. Stay on the marked path, heed any local signs, and share your plans with someone. Be mindful of other pedestrians and cyclists. In an emergency, call 999.
recommended_gear: Sun protection (hat and sunscreen) if sunny
Phone with charged battery and map or offline route
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn; be prepared for rain and cooler weather in winter.
